intro: Croton gracilipes var. angustifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaf croton, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves that are typically arranged alternately along the stem. The plant produces small, clustered yellowish-green flowers that bloom during the wet season. Its growth habit is often shrub-like, with a branching structure that can reach up to several meters in height. The leaves and stems contain milky sap, which is a common feature among members of the Euphorbiaceae family.
